title: MBTA Hingham ferry service canceled for Feb. 13 due to ice in the harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Hingham/Hull ferry service canceled on Feb. 13 due to thick ice in Boston Harbor.
Shuttle buses replace ferry, running from Nantasket Beach to Hull Ferry Terminal, first bus at 6:30 a.m.
Recent winter storm causing cancellations, ferry not affected by thick ice for 8-10 years, said MBTA director.

title: Retired Gloucester firefighter dies days after being struck by Lowell police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Retired Gloucester firefighter Daniel Kennedy died after being hit by a Lowell police cruiser at UMass Lowell.
The incident occurred on Wilder Street outside the McGauvran Center; Kennedy died at Lahey Hospital days later.
Authorities, including Massachusetts State Police, are investigating the circumstances of the February 5 collision.

title: 5 players on Red Sox’ roster bubble entering spring training
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Triston Casas may start the season in Triple-A Worcester due to health concerns and competition at first base.
Kristian Campbell, aiming for a comeback, is likely to start 2026 in Triple-A Worcester, facing competition for DH spots.
Pitchers Payton Tolle and Connelly Early are expected to start with Worcester due to the crowded Red Sox pitching roster.

title: Plans confirmed for new ICE facility in N.H.; documents reveal state officials knew for weeks
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: ACLU-NH released documents showing New Hampshire officials knew about the ICE facility plans as early as January 12, 2026.
Merrimack, N.H. site planned as a part of ICE's nationwide renovation project for 80,000 detainees, causing local unrest.
Governor Kelly Ayotte denies prior knowledge of facility plans, initiating an investigation following Commissioner Sarah Stewart's resignation.

title: Ex-Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia isn’t panicking over Will Campbell’s play
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Will Campbell to remain at left tackle despite struggles in the 2025 season and Super Bowl loss.
Former Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia supports continued development for Campbell at tackle, despite late-season performance dip.
Former Pro Bowl tackle Terron Armstead invites Campbell for offseason training to address power and timing challenges.

title: Video: Mike Vrabel shares message to distraught Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel consoled Patriots players after their 29-13 Super Bowl LX loss to the Seattle Seahawks at Levi's Stadium.
The Patriots' successful 2025 season included 14 regular-season wins and an AFC East title under first-year head coach Mike Vrabel.
Vrabel emphasized unity and growth post-defeat, highlighting a strong foundation for the Patriots' young roster moving forward.

title: Patriots reportedly make changes to coaching staff, move Williams to ‘high-ranking’ role
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots move Terrell Williams to a 'high-ranking' role on Mike Vrabel's staff after a health-related leave.
Zak Kuhr is favored to become Patriots' new defensive coordinator after leading as interim during Super Bowl season.
Williams, now cancer-free, supports Kuhr's defensive leadership; Kuhr led the defense to fourth in points allowed.

title: Pittsfield man, 69, killed in hit-and-run crash that dragged him ‘lengthy distance,’ DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Colbert, 69, was killed in a hit-and-run in Pittsfield after being dragged by a vehicle Tuesday night.
The incident occurred near Linden Street and Francis Avenue, involving a dark-colored sedan that fled the scene.
Authorities are seeking information or surveillance footage related to the hit-and-run involving William Colbert.

title: ‘This is only the beginning’: Ann Michael Maye shares encouraging message after Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Ann Michael Maye expressed gratitude on Instagram following Patriots' 29-13 Super Bowl loss to the Seahawks.
Drake Maye set a Super Bowl record with 235 passing yards in one quarter despite a rough start and injury.
Ann Michael Maye gained popularity with her 'Bakemas' videos, enhancing her personal following alongside her husband's career.

title: This dad is running Boston to give back to Boston Children’s Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Nick Gallagher, 38, from Plymouth, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Boston Children's Hospital’s Miles for Miracles team.
Gallagher is inspired by the care his 4-year-old son received at Boston Children's Hospital since birth for neurological issues.
The Miles for Miracles team supports families and children who benefit from advanced treatments and care at Boston Children's Hospital.
